section.title: How New Tenancies Get Started
section.para: &PRODUCTABBR; identifies state and local education agencies as different tenancies. Each tenant has access to its own set of data, and the same &PRODUCTABBR; data store can serve multiple tenancies. In most cases, there exists a hierarchy of tenancies served by the same data store: the state education organizations and the local levels below it (district, county, city, etc.).

When a new tenancy comes on board with &COMPANYABBR;, an existing administrator for that &PRODUCTABBR; deployment must create the new tenancy using administration tools. This process is covered in &PRODUCTABBR; administrator documentation.

Part of on-boarding a new tenancy, the administrator must, at a minimum, create an administrator account that serves that tenancy. Then, either that new administrator or another authoritative administrator must create the following for that tenancy a landing zone and one or more users with the Ingestion User role.

listitem.para: A landing zone, which is a group of resources allocated to ingesting data for the tenancy.
One or more &PRODUCTABBR; user accounts with the Ingestion User role. If you are ingesting data, you must use the credentials of one of these accounts.

section.para: With the administrators, landing zones, and ingestion users in place, a tenancy can ingest its first set of data to the &PRODUCTABBR; data store and, afterward, begin regular use of &PRODUCT;.
